node.statement: Define the O-admissible family F_O. Given a transfer system O on G, let Sub_O^tr(G) = {H <= G : tr_H^G is in O}. Define F_O as the family of subgroups generated by Sub_O^tr(G), i.e., the smallest collection closed under subconjugacy and conjugation containing Sub_O^tr(G). Prove that F_O is well-defined and is a family of subgroups of G. [Key insight from Strategy C: Sub_O^tr(G) itself may NOT be closed under taking subgroups for general incomplete transfer systems, so the family generation step is essential.]
